title: Really stuck trying to id the "Samantha" text, not sure if the S is part of the font or not... Thanks
content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317120705im_/http:/typophile.com/files/front_4252.jpg)

Font: 

 Hawaii Lover 

Solved By: 

 [fvilanakis](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317120705/http:/typophile.com/user/176276 "View user profile.")

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [front.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317120705/http:/typophile.com/files/front_2.jpg) | 53.35 KB |
author: jonnorman43

comments.content:
It looks like **[Loki Cola](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317120705/http:/www.findmyfont.com/index.php/fonts/font-preview?fset=Dafont-1&ffam=Loki%20Cola%20-%20Regular&fid=2ebdcbc9946219e929e10c06d273a14d&fsize=60&text=Samantha&fit=1)** free font by Dale Harris (1999)  
The /S seems modified or taken from another font

On a second thought "Samantha" (including /S) is set on **[Hawaii Lover](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317120705/http:/www.findmyfont.com/index.php/fonts/font-preview?fset=Dafont-1&ffam=Hawaii%20Lover%20-%20Regular&fid=c5e42a23c1e183fee9b0564ed82eaa31&fsize=60&text=Samantha&fit=1)** by Andrew Hart [2009, Free for personal use]
Thanks very much fvilanakis ... your suggestion was spot on!
